docs.title: About Us
docs.text:
The Internet of Things research group is led by Prof. Dimitrios Zorbas. Its purpose is to conduct research and develop modern Internet of Things communication and sensing systems. The topics of interest include but are not limited to communication protocols, embedded programming, smart sensing systems, machine learning for IoT, and prototype development.

  • Members
  • Projects
  • Equipment
  • Software
  • Publications

docs.title: Our Research Interests
docs.text:
• Low power communications
  • Internet of Things protocols
  • Embedded computing
  • Edge computing
  • Machine learning
  • Prototypes

docs.title: Publications
docs.text:
1. Nurmukhammed Aitymbetov and Dimitrios Zorbas. Autonomous machine learning-based peer reviewer selection system. In Proceedings of the 31st International Conference on Computational Linguistics: System Demonstrations, 199–207. Abu Dhabi, UAE, January 2025. Association for Computational Linguistics. ↩

  2. Dimitrios Zorbas and Aruzhan Sabyrbek. Supporting critical downlink traffic in lorawan. Computer Communications, 228:107981, 2024. URL: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0140366424003281, doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.comcom.2024.107981. ↩

  3. Batyrkhan Baimukhanov, Bibarys Gilazh, and Dimitrios Zorbas. Autonomous lightweight scheduling in lora-based networks using reinforcement learning. In 2024 IEEE International Black Sea Conference on Communications and Networking (BlackSeaCom), volume, 268–271. 2024. doi:10.1109/BlackSeaCom61746.2024.10646280. ↩

  4. Temirlan Nurbay, Sultan Kasenov, Adi Yeltay, and Dimitrios Zorbas. Cooperative transmission of large files over lora in multimedia lot networks. In 2024 IEEE International Black Sea Conference on Communications and Networking (BlackSeaCom), volume, 153–158. 2024. doi:10.1109/BlackSeaCom61746.2024.10646253. ↩

  5. Rakhat Khamitov, Daniil Orel, and Dimitrios Zorbas. Predicting solar-harvested energy for resource-constrained iot devices using machine learning. In 2024 20th International Conference on Distributed Computing in Smart Systems and the Internet of Things (DCOSS-IoT), volume, 661–668. 2024. doi:10.1109/DCOSS-IoT61029.2024.00103. ↩

  6. Damir Assylbek, Aizhuldyz Nadirkhanova, and Dimitrios Zorbas. Energy-efficient Clock-Synchronization in IoT Using Reinforcement Learning . In 2024 20th International Conference on Distributed Computing in Smart Systems and the Internet of Things (DCOSS-IoT), volume, 244–248. Los Alamitos, CA, USA, May 2024. IEEE Computer Society. URL: https://doi.ieeecomputersociety.org/10.1109/DCOSS-IoT61029.2024.00044, doi:10.1109/DCOSS-IoT61029.2024.00044. ↩

  7. Aida Eduard, Dnislam Urazayev, Aruzhan Sabyrbek, Daniil Orel, and Dimitrios Zorbas. Ad-hoc train-arrival notification system for railway safety in remote areas. Internet of Things, 25:101062, 2024. URL: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2542660524000040, doi:https://doi.org/10.1016/j.iot.2024.101062. ↩

  8. Shahzeb Javed and Dimitrios Zorbas. A lorawan adaptive retransmission mechanism. In 2023 IEEE Conference on Standards for Communications and Networking (CSCN), volume, 324–327. 2023. doi:10.1109/CSCN60443.2023.10453118. ↩

  9. Temirlan Zarymkanov, Amin Kargar, Cristina M. Pinotti, Brendan O’Flynn, and Dimitrios Zorbas. Enhancing machine learning training performance in smart agriculture datasets using a mobile app. In 2023 IEEE International Workshop on Metrology for Agriculture and Forestry (MetroAgriFor), volume, 455–460. 2023. doi:10.1109/MetroAgriFor58484.2023.10424407. ↩

  10. Leonard J. Zurek, Amin Kargar, Brendan O’Flynn, David Niederprüm, Lars Wolf, and Dimitrios Zorbas. Evaluation of wireless technologies for an embedded camera-based pest monitoring system. In 2023 IEEE International Workshop on Metrology for Agriculture and Forestry (MetroAgriFor), volume, 449–454. 2023. doi:10.1109/MetroAgriFor58484.2023.10424396. ↩

  11. Batyrkhan Baimukhanov and Dimitrios Zorbas. Infrastructure-less long-range text-messaging system. In 2023 International Conference on Information and Communication Technologies for Disaster Management (ICT-DM), volume, 1–4. 2023. doi:10.1109/ICT-DM58371.2023.10286942. ↩
